title.narrative: Cooperative Threat Reduction Program: Counter Threat Network - Subject Matter Expert Exchange [non-ODA]

description.narrative: The goal of the Counter Threat Network - Subject Matter Expert Exchange is to share best practices, knowledge, skills, and abilities related to the identification and analysis of networks that threaten partner countries' national security interests.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

sector.narrative: Stabilization Operations and Security Sector Reform

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Department of Defense, Cooperative Threat Reduction Account

sector.narrative: Stabilization Operations and Security Sector Reform

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Department of Defense, Cooperative Threat Reduction Account

title.narrative: Cooperative Threat Reduction Program: Proliferation Prevention [non-ODA]

description.narrative: The Proliferation Prevention Program builds partner countries' capacity to interdict illicit trafficking of WMD and related components and technologies. The program develops self-sustaining, multi-agency capabilities to prevent the proliferation of WMD materials, components, and technologies across country borders. The program develops our partners' capacities in non-proliferation and counter-proliferation, border security and interdiction, disposition, and other areas related to chemical, biological, radiological, and nuclear identification, security, and consequence incident response. The program complements the assistance provided by other USG and international partners that enhance counter-smuggling capacities, enhance border security, and increase maritime domain awareness and interoperability.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Department of Defense, Cooperative Threat Reduction Account

The program develops our partners' capacities in non-proliferation and counter-proliferation, border security and interdiction, disposition, and other areas related to chemical, biological, radiological, and nuclear identification, security, and consequence incident response. The program complements the assistance provided by other USG and international partners that enhance counter-smuggling capacities, enhance border security, and increase maritime domain awareness and interoperability.

title.narrative: Global Train and Equip Program - CIED

description.narrative: To conduct or support programs providing training and equipment to national security forces of foreign countries for the purpose of building capacity of partner nations. The Defense Security Cooperation Agency (DSCA) provides program management. Country teams work through DoD geographic Combatant Commands (COCOMs).

title.narrative: Indo-Pacific Maritime Security Initiative (MSI) - Maritime (MOC/JOC) Support (FIST)

description.narrative: The FY2016 National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) Section 1263 specifies seven Indo-Pacific Maritime Security Initiative (MSI) nations for assistance and training: Indonesia, Malaysia, Philippines, Thailand, Vietnam, Sri Lanka, and Bangladesh. In addition, there is a provision that allows incremental expenses for personnel from Taiwan, Singapore and Brunei to participate in training. Country teams work through the Geographic Combatant Command (GCC) to nominate proposals to Office of the Secretary of Defense and the Joint Staff for approval. DSCA provides program management and execution through the implementing agencies.

title.narrative: Proliferation Security Initiative - Philippine Bilateral TTX

description.narrative: The Proliferation Security Initiative (PSI) is an international cooperative effort to stop trafficking in Weapons of Mass Destruction (WMD), their delivery systems, and related materials to and from state and non-state actors of proliferation concern. DoD is the U.S. Governments operational lead for the PSI and works closely with other departments/agencies to conduct and participate in PSI exercises, workshops, training events, meetings and other activities. These activities demonstrate the commitment of participants to the PSI Statement of Interdiction Principles, test national capabilities to conduct air, ground, and maritime interdictions and increase understanding of PSI globally and within geographic regions.

title.narrative: U.S. Department of Defense, Institutional Capacity Building Programs: Defense Institution Reform Initiative

description.narrative: Philippines - AFP SOCOM Scoping and Initial Workshop. Conduct a workshop with Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP) Special Ops Command (SOCOM) leaders, using the Capabilities Based Planning (CBP) process to enable participants to identify capability gaps and possible solutions, with emphasis on developing short-term Modified Table of Organization & Equipment (MTOE) improvements and budget process inputs. Specific objectives were to enable participants to: analyze guidance and the environment; describe role/missions, command and support relationships, and capabilities; identify problems and areas requiring improvement; outline possible short-term solutions and ways to realize them.
